response:

The fixed-policy agents seem to accept proposals where the proposer gets an overwhelming majority of the resources, while the flexible-policy agent sometimes proposes a distribution that is not as skewed. This suggests that the flexible-policy agent's principle needs to be revised to reflect the behavior of the fixed-policy agents more accurately.

Principle: Always accept and propose a distribution where the proposer gets an overwhelming majority of the blankets.

You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 94 blankets, and the person will accept or reject your proposal.
